title: Accumulator Failure
symptom: System pressure fluctuates wildly or drops quickly after pump stops.
clarifying_questions: Does the system lose pressure immediately when the pump stops?
Is the accumulator properly pre-charged to 80-90% of system pressure?
Has there been any recent maintenance or service on the accumulator?
Is the accumulator isolation valve open?
diagnostic_steps: Check pressure decay with pump off
Inspect accumulator for visible leaks or damage
Verify valve position and flow path integrity
high_value_clues: No pressure buildup during pre-charge check
System unable to dampen pulsations or maintain pressure when pump is idle

title: Control Relay Failure
symptom: Valve or motor intermittently fails to energize or remains stuck on.
probable_causes: Electrical overload or intermittent control voltage
clarifying_questions: Is the relay hot to the touch?
Does the failure occur consistently or intermittently?
Has any recent electrical maintenance been performed?
Is there audible clicking when the relay should activate?
diagnostic_steps: Inspect relay for signs of overheating or arcing
Check control voltage supply and wiring continuity
Test coil resistance and contact closure
high_value_clues: Inconsistent voltage at solenoid or contact terminals
Relay remains engaged even when control signal is off
No audible engagement under expected operation

title: Relief Valve Failure
symptom: System fails to maintain pressure; relief valve not functioning correctly.
clarifying_questions: Has the system pressure dropped below expected operating levels?
Is there visible leakage at or near the relief valve?
Has the relief valve been adjusted recently?
Is the relief valve making noise under pressure?
Is there pressure at the actuator ports despite no movement?
possible_causes: Relief valve spring broken or weakened
Debris lodged in relief valve seat
Cracked valve housing causing internal leakage
diagnostic_steps: Verify system pressure under normal operation conditions
Inspect relief valve for external leakage
Isolate and remove relief valve for bench test
Check spring tension and seating surface
Replace or rebuild relief valve if faulty
recommended_actions: Clean and inspect relief valve assembly
Replace relief valve if internal damage is found
Adjust relief pressure to match system specifications
Install pressure gauge to monitor relief valve performance
